p: Investments in public health and in science should continue, including basic science, and translational to clinical research. Several research groups are pursuing a vaccine capable of curbing the ongoing expansion of the disease and rapidly decreasing related mortality. Adequate investments can contribute to the coordination, cooperation and creation of international research networks to attain an appropriate response to outbreaks and pandemics. There are still countless questions without answers, given research and treatment results are being developed as the pandemic spreads. Although we are still facing the unknown, some general recommendations, in addition to technical recommendations, have already been well established: social isolation and protection of the most vulnerable individuals are mandatory, and the health of anesthesiologists is the most precious good at this time of crisis, due to their role in the frontline to face COVID-19.
